title.native: デッドマウント・デスプレイ

description:
As a legendary hero nears victory against a necromancer known as The Corpse God, things take an unexpected turn with the dark sorcerer’s final gambit—reincarnation magic. This last-ditch effort catches the brave fighter off guard, and now he’s a boy named Polka Shinoyama in a whole new world! The showdown between good and evil just got epic.

(Source: Crunchyroll)

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Necromancy
tags.description: When the dead are summoned as spirits, skeletons, or the undead, usually for the purpose of gaining information or to be used as a weapon.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Reincarnation
tags.description: Features a character being born again after death, typically as another person or in another world.

tags.name: Ghost
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a ghost.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Seinen
tags.description: Target demographic is adult males.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Police
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of law enforcement officers.

tags.name: Assassins
tags.description: Centers around characters who murder people as a profession.

tags.name: Gangs
tags.description: Centers around gang organizations.

tags.name: Cult
tags.description: Features a social group with unorthodox religious, spiritual, or philosophical beliefs and practices.

tags.name: Detective
tags.description: Features a character who investigates and solves crimes.

tags.name: Fugitive
tags.description: Prominently features a character evading capture by an individual or organization.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Skeleton
tags.description: Prominently features skeleton(s) as a character.

tags.name: Zombie
tags.description: Prominently features reanimated corpses which often prey on live humans and turn them into zombies.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Bar
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a bar.

tags.name: Noir
tags.description: Stylized as a cynical crime drama with low-key visuals.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Vampire
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a vampire.

tags.name: Exorcism
tags.description: Involving religious methods of vanquishing youkai, demons, or other supernatural entities.

tags.name: Large Breasts
tags.description: Features a character with larger-than-average breasts.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

name.native: シャグルア・エディス・ルグリッド
イーズリーズ・ソルドフレイル

alternative: Kaijin Solitaire (怪人 ソリティア)

node.description:
__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ryohgo_narita)__

_Ryougo Narita_ is a Japanese light novelist and manga writer. He won the Gold Prize in the 9th Dengeki Novel Prize for Baccano!, which was made into an anime television series in 2007. His series Durarara!! was also made into two anime television series, one airing in January 2010 and the second in January 2015.

(Source: Wikipedia)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/gaku3900) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/小野学_(アニメーション監督%29)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/gaku3900) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/小野学_(アニメーション監督%29)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/阿部恒)

Freelancer. He was a long-time [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/) employee who switched over to [Mappa](https://anilist.co/studio/569/) with [Masao Maruyama](https://anilist.co/staff/103170/).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/gaku3900) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/小野学_(アニメーション監督%29)

[Profile (F.M.F)](http://www.fmf-music.com/members/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/eba_cadode) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/eba_1987_/)

Eba is a Japanese music producer, guitarist, composer, arranger and member of pop unit [cadode](https://twitter.com/cadode_). He is also affiliated with F.M.F Corporation.

_Note: Not to be confused with the vocalist and lyricist with the same name [Hirokazu Ebata aka Eba](https://anilist.co/staff/161178)_

__[Website](https://www.yukinara.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Yuki_Nara_217) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yukinara217/)__

__Yuuki Nara__ is a Japanese guitarist, lyricist, composer and arranger affiliated with F.M.F Corporation.

Utatane Kana is a lyricist, composer, arranger and pianist from Fukuoka Prefecture, Japan. She works for Tawara and is part of KanadeYUK.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Utatanekana)

__Height:__ 154 cm 
__Agency:__ AXL-ONE

__[Website](https://inoriminase.com)__ | __[Profile (AXL-ONE)](http://axl-one.com/talent/minase.html)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/inoriminase)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/inoriminase_info/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCYBwKaLwCGY7k3auR_FLanA)__

A Japanese voice actress and singer-songwriter under entertainment agency Axlone (2017–) and record label King Records (2015–), having previously been under entertainment agency Sony Music Entertainment (2010–2017). She has been active as a voice actor since 2010, debuting in the anime Occult Academy voicing the character Akari Okamoto, while debuting as a singer-songwriter in December 2015.

Inori was born in Tokyo, where she began watching anime in kindergarten. She first became aware of voice acting when, after watching a stage play adaption of an anime, she read the stage pamphlet and asked her parents about a person mentioned in it. She found out that she wanted to become a voice actor at the age of six, and at elementary school she listed voice acting as her desired future career. 

In middle school, Inori joined her school's tennis and theater clubs, however, she quit the theater club due to feeling too embarrassed when appearing on stage. Around the same time, her mother found a magazine advertising for a voice-acting audition, which she participated in and won.

(Source: Wikipedia, edited)

**Non-anime roles:**
- Iris - Memento Mori (VG)
- Soline - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Furina - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Balloon Party - Reverse: 1999 (VG)

__Height:__ 168 cm
__Likes:__ Winter, Video Games, Blobfish, Cats, Beef, Ramen, Cheesecake
__Dislikes:__ Summer, Corn
__Favorite Artists:__ [BUMP OF CHICKEN](https://anilist.co/staff/109225/BUMP-OF-CHICKEN), [ONE OK ROCK](https://anilist.co/staff/126954/One-Ok-Rock), [Sekai no Owari](https://anilist.co/staff/121606/Sekai-no-Owari), [YUI](https://anilist.co/staff/100287/Yui), [DOES](https://anilist.co/staff/104260/DOES) and [Porno Graffitti](https://anilist.co/staff/102716/Porno-Graffitti)

__[Website](https://sou-official.jp/)__ | __[Profile (Universal Music Japan)](https://www.universal-music.co.jp/sou/biography/)__  | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nico_nico_sou)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCLAhLxCcqi5afnNTQNnfX-g)__

__Introduction:__
Sou is a Japanese vocalist and lyricist under record label Universal Music Japan (2019-), having previously been under EXIT TUNES (2015-2016) and Saihate Records (2016-2019). Prior to 2015, he was to perform as an utaite on the site Nico Nico Douga.

__Biography:__
On October 2013, he started performing as a singer on the video uploading site Nico Nico Douga. He was only 15 years old at the time. Two years later on December 2, 2015, he made his major debut with the release of his first album titled "[Suisou Regulus](https://open.spotify.com/album/1shHHMbW5b08I9HZTPIeMY)" through the record label EXIT TUNES.

After his major debut in 2015, he would release other works in collaboration with other utaite such as Nayutan, [Harumaki Gohan](https://twitter.com/harumaki_gohan) and [Eve](https://anilist.co/staff/132869/Eve), while also forming and participating in music unit "[Okaeritte Ie](https://utaite.fandom.com/wiki/Category:Okaeritte_Ie)" with utaite Wolpis Carter and Isubokuro. As of July 2019, he has accumulated over 4.5 million views on his cover of Eve's song titled "Literary Nonsense", and 13 million views on his cover of Chouchou-P's song titled "Kokoronashi". Both becoming quite popular through the tides of time.

On March 2019, he released his first song "Parade of Fools", which he himself wrote and composed, while on May of the same year, he made his first one-man live performance with "Salir" at the Akasaka Blitz in Tokyo, Japan.

(Source: [Wikipedia (JP)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sou), edited | [Fandom (Utaite)](https://utaite.fandom.com/wiki/Sou), edited)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Kirai_dark) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCgf4ASaUXSl960o8wXWHGdQ) | [Nico Nico](https://www.nicovideo.jp/user/87208347/mylist/64274667?ref=pc_userpage_mylist) | [Bilibili](https://space.bilibili.com/679721539) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@kirai_dark) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/6enAUr8uYLFYHKDcnRUst2)
